answers.answer: I wouldn't suspect that. Diabetes is insulin not iron
I'm assuming the lab work came back you're anemic, def doesn't mean you have GD, wait til you speak with dr before you worry!!

Yeah i know diabetes is insulin. I was just wondering if the two were strongly related. Thanks ladies. I'll pick up the prescription in a few but i won't take them until after speaking with my doctor in the morning.
I had low iron and not gd so I wouldn't worry about that

Your iron levels have nothing to do with your blood sugar. Nothing to worry about really especially since you'll talk to them tomorrow. Increasing your iron is important for sure but it's not an emergency. If there are other issues with your labs there's no way to know from what you've posted but if they only sent one script to the pharmacy it sounds like you're doing okay. They'll fill you in.
I was diagnosed with Anemia, when I took my GD test. Not GD though :)

No your anemic hun you just need to eat fish stuff that's got iron in it and take your tablets hun don't wait to take them I've been anemic before and its not nice take them and phone your doctors hun

Iron is spread through the body through the blood and invested through food... And although diabetes is in some way related to what u eat it is up to the pancreas.... The pancreas is what provides insulin to get rid of the glucose...  So I wouldn't worry they aren't connected in anyway.... Sorry if it doesn't make sense I am a nursing student and tried to simplify it :) but hope it helps
Thanks mamas. I understand all responses and really appreciate them.
I got the same call it was only low Iron I didn't have diabetes

question: Great. Now that i have your attention, please read.Last Monday i took the glucose test and was told if they didn't call me by Friday everything was fine. So i missed a call today from my doctor saying they wanted to go over lab results (they're closed now so I'm calling first thing in the morning). I also got a call from the pharmacy that my prescription was ready. So i called them and asked what it's for. She said iron tablets. My question is since i obviously have low iron does that mean i also have gestational diabetes as well? Or is there anyone that got the same results as me and everything is fine. I'm not too worried just kinda want a heads up on what'll be discussed in the morning as far as lab results. Thanks
title: am i pregnant???
